paper_abstract: In 2009, Rey and Sanchez proposed a protocol to solve the oblivious transfer problem using quadratic residues and Jacobi symbols. The goal of this paper is to prove that the scheme of Rey and Sanchez does not achieve the security requirements of this problem in the sense that the sender can learn the secrets retrieved by the receiver and thereby violate his privacy. (C) 2014 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A note on "Selling multiple secrets to a single buyer"
